author: Reuters Editorial
title: Poland - Factors to Watch Apr 12
text:
Following are news stories, press reports and events to watch that may affect Poland’s financial markets on Thursday. ALL TIMES GMT (Poland: GMT + 2 hours):
INTEREST RATES Poland’s central bank on Wednesday kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged at a record low of 1.50 percent, in line with the expectations of analysts polled by Reuters.
PLAY Polish telecoms operator Play Communications plans to pay out a gross interim dividend of 2.57 zlotys ($0.7593) per share, the company said late Wednesday.
RULE OF LAW Parliament’s voting over the supreme court bill could take place on Thursday evening, Rzeczpospolita daily said. The paper Quote: d the speaker of higher house of parliament as saying that Poland wants to end the dispute with the EU soon.
GRUPA AZOTY Poland’s biggest chemical group Azoty plans acquisitions in Poland and on foreign markets, Parkiet daily said quoting the company’s CEO. Azoty are in talks over buying German Compo Expert, which analysts say could be valued at 1 billion zlotys.
PLL LOT Pilots at Polish airlines PLL LOT will decide on April 21 whether to go on strike as they demand salary increase, Gazeta Wyborcza daily said.
****Reuters has not verified stories reported by Polish media and does not vouch for their accuracy.****
